text: Order of the General Court (Ninth Chamber) of 22 October 2019 – BMC v Commission and Clean Sky 2 Joint Undertaking

text: (Action for annulment — Research and technological development and space — (Horizon 2020) - the Framework Programme for Research and Innovation (2014-2020) — Procedure for call for proposals H2020-CS 2 -CFP08-FRC‑2018-01 — Development of a suction and protection against icing system for the engine of helicopters with rotor blades — Rejection of the proposal submitted by the applicant — Identification of the defendant — Partial inadmissibility)
label: DATE
DATE

text: Action for annulment — Admissibility criteria — Action against the author of the contested measure — Exceptions — Measures adopted under delegated powers imputable to the delegating institution — Scope

Action under Article 263 TFEU seeking the annulment of the decision of the joint undertaking Clean Sky 2 of 6 December 2018 rejecting the request for a review of the assessment of proposal No 831874 ‘smart De-icing bARrier Filter (DwARF)’ submitted by the applicant in call for proposals H2020-CS 2 -CFP08-FRC‑2018-01 and confirming the decision of the joint undertaking Clean Sky 2 of 10 October 2018 by which it rejected that proposal.
label: ORG
DATE
TITLE
ORG
DATE

text: The action is dismissed as inadmissible in so far as it is directed against the European Commission.
label: ORG

text: BMC Srl shall pay the costs relating to the present proceedings on the plea of inadmissibility.
label: ORG
